other_tests.findings: Maturing trilineage hematopoiesis and mildly hypercellular marrow with many histiocytes and numerous engulfed erythroid elements in the cytoplasm. Findings consistent with hemophagocytosis; no evidence of infection or lymphoma.
Focal epidermal erosion with impetiginized scale crust and a mild lymphohistiocytic infiltrate; no fungal organisms identified. Findings were nondiagnostic, with no evidence of lymphoma.
No evidence of malignant cells; staining for amyloid was negative.

Atypical proliferation of medium-to-large pleomorphic cells in the dermis and subcutaneous tissue, associated with prominent karyorrhexis. Immunohistochemical stains showed CD3+ T cells; retention of CD2 with loss of CD4, CD8, and CD5.
